Message.Title: 573,000 jobs lost in March 2013
Message.Msg: The Obama Dept of Labor falsely reports 88,000 new jobs while 663,000 drop out of labor market in march. Doing the math that is a LOSS 573,000 jobs for march not a gain. There is no gain it's a completely fabricated lie to hide the actual loss. This is how Obama hides the skyrocketing unemployment by deliberately manipulating and misrepresenting the data every month. The unemployed are hidden in the pile of 90 million people who are out of the labor market but not counted as unemployment. Why I am posting to Yahoo? Because Yahoo was completely fooled and did not report this. Had Bush tried this stunt, the libs at Yahoo "news" would have been all over it screaming bloody murder.

Topic.Title: Better than Yelp, Angi, Zillow, Open Table or MeetMe - All Yahoo should not buy

Message.Msg: The Strategy of Local Corp We believe that we are in the early stages of a large and long-term business opportunity presented by the shift of local marketing budgets from traditional media formats to digital media formats. Our strategy for pursuing this opportunity includes the following key components: • Increase growth drivers: Key to driving our growth is: the expansion of both our reach (the number of MUVs we serve) and the monetization of that reach (how much ad revenue we generate from those users); and by increasing the number of SMB customers using our platform. • Diversify product offerings : In 2010 and 2011, we took steps to diversify our revenue sources, while maintaining our focus on local offerings through the acquisition of: Octane360, which serves as the technology platform for many of our SMB ad products, in the third quarter of 2010; Krillion, which provides near-real-time product and inventory information; and SMG in mid-2011. Our development and acquisition efforts also represent a point of differentiation from an increasingly crowded field in online advertising. We believe that a diversity of offerings will differentiate us from certain of our competitors that may offer only one or two of our services, but not the full suite of our product offerings which we believe appeals to our customers and partners alike.

Message.Title: Ignorant speculation
Message.Msg: Yahoo will buy Mixed Media Labs. Why? They are in the forefront of unFacebooking us. Check this :"Imagine the inconvenience that Rushkoff now faces having unbundled from Facebook. He cannot take his social graph of all his friends and followers with him. He cannot use Facebook as a defacto web passport to authenticate his identity on other sites. He cannot move the content he created on Facebook elsewhere. And he cannot know how what he leaves behind will be used in his absence." Exactly what MM hinted.

Topic.Title: Peter Chernin makes a bid for Hulu

Message.Msg: Oh, I've only used Hulu, 3 times now including watching the JT highlights and the actual SNL episode. Hulu, also has the Netflix model where you pay per month and then don't get the commercials, $8 per month. I have access to Netflix too but don't watch it much...knocked out the 3 of the 4 seasons of The League, hilarious to those who are in Fantasy Football and now trying to see Downton Abbey but haven't gotten through the 1st episode. I wouldn't mind owning Downton Abbey that is for sure! Amazon's Prime is great and allows you to rent recently released movies but it didn't stream very well when I tried it, a few months ago. Content is expensive, I read that for Netflix's House of Cards it was like $3.65M per episode. Like I said I agree Hulu being a viable option for Yahoo.

Message.Title: yahoo email functions
Message.Msg: I no longer have the Slideshow option button when I open yahoo email with photos attached.. How do I get it back? I tried help..no luck. thanks

Topic.Title: Peter Chernin makes a bid for Hulu

Message.Msg: Yep I pay the 8$ but in Canada I don't have access to most US networks. NO Downton Abbey! That's funny I checked the Amazon price on Downton not long ago. I will buy it because it is something I will watch again. I was really into House of Cards - just happy to have some new content - but I watched 5 or 6 episodes over a couple of days when it first came out & haven't gone back. I will finish it. I think I will watch the original Brit version of HoC before I finish the American. Yep, I like the idea of Chernin buying Hulu & then Yahoo swooping in & buying up Chernin's group. Stranger things have happened. Any ideas or guesses as to what acquisition Mayer & De Castro are not agreeing on?

Topic.Title: Peter Chernin makes a bid for Hulu

Message.Msg: Read the article closer. This bid was made 2 years ago. Reuters, which first reported Chernin’s interest in Hulu, says he offered $500 million for the site; two years ago, when Hulu’s owners put the site on the block, they were looking for $2 billion.

Topic.Title: Ignorant speculation

Message.Msg: Or perhaps she is just Building one. Yahoo Patent # 20130086078: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR GENERATION OF A DYNAMIC SOCIAL PAGE. The present disclosure includes methods and systems for dynamically rendering a social page of the user based on the visiting user's interests. When a visiting user visits another user's social page, the visiting user will be presented with information from the user's social page related to interests for which the visiting user has exhibited an interest.

Topic.Title: Peter Chernin makes a bid for Hulu

Message.Msg: What? Hulu was on the auction block in late 2011, Chernin may have made an offer, remember Yahoo was also supposed to make an offer. Hulu took themselves off the auction block then because they were unhappy with the bids being so far under the $2B they were looking for. The Reuters article, and others, states that there is a current bid, Bloomberg says last week & Reuters says in March. Last week was late March. I don't know what article you're reading...
